A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It's a very typical 2nd part of 3 in a movie franchise. Transitional\, like a game of chess it moves the pieces it needs to where it needs them to be ready for the endgame and sacrifices those no longer required. It lacks a really spectacular scene\, an epic duel or something. And I found myself almost cursing at the screen in frustration as a scene in the ending almost appeared to clearly rip off Independence Day yet manage to end in a terrible\, predictable Deus Ex Machina. That said it has to be noted that Mark Hamill puts in a marvellous performance as an aging Luke Skywalker.
